I hope make sens.

data.title: Make search results and preferences panes behave more like other panes
data.body: It would be nice if one could change font size in search results and preferences panes, just like one does in the other panes, eg. by using ctrl+mouse wheel; also, the same panes can't be scrolled with the keyboard.

data.title: ctrl+shift+d does not duplicate the line
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? Yes
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? Yes, 1.7.4 on windows 7
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? Yes, still having issues
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? Yes
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? I believe so
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? Yes, did not find anything

When I press `ctrl+shift+d` to try to duplicate a line it never duplicates. If I open the command pallet and run 'Editor: Duplicate Lines' it works. Next to the command it shows the shortcut as being `ctrl+shift+d`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/994964/15472912/6bea07b0-20cb-11e6-829d-3e144ec22f9c.png)

I also checked my keymap.cson to make sure nothing was in there and nothing has been added. 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom (normal or safe mode)
2. Type anything on a tab
3. Press `Ctrl+Shift+D`, the line does not duplicate for me

**Expected behavior:** The line to duplicate

**Actual behavior:** Nothing happens
### Versions

Confirmed on 1.7.3 and 1.7.4. I don't recall if it was happening before 1.7.3.

data.title: Atom command line opens up a Windows shell in Git Bash.
data.body:
### Description

The atom command line no longer opens files in the editor in Windows 10. Instead it opens up a type of shell and expects input. This happens in Git Bash but not `cmd`. It's happening on multiple Windows 10 machines around the office.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open up Git Bash on Windows
2. Cd to a folder you want to open in atom
3. Run `atom .` or `atom foldernamehere` to open up a folder

**Expected behavior:**
Atom will open up a new window with the folder added as a project folder

**Actual behavior:**
A type of shell opens up and expects input from the user. See screenshot.
![atom-command-line](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6545164/15471686/dd6205c8-20bc-11e6-9aee-8c5e93775901.PNG)
### Versions

Atom 1.7.4
Windows 10
Git Bash 2.8.3 MINGW64
### Workarounds

These workarounds may or may not work depending on your bash versions.

**Running atom.cmd**
Running `atom.cmd .` will produce the expected behavior. (@mikew)

**Aliasing atom.cmd**
Add an alias in your .bashrc `alias atom='atom.cmd'` (@DGempler)

data.title: cmd + ` does not swap Atom windows in same workspace OSX
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

cmd + ` doesn't swap Atom windows in same workspace on OSX
### Steps to Reproduce
1. open two Atom windows in same workspace
2. press cmd + `

**Expected behavior:** should swap windows

**Actual behavior:** nothing
### Versions

Atom version 1.7.3

OSX version 10.11.4

data.title: Allow creation of "phantom lines" in Gutter and text editor
data.body:
It would be nice if [Gutter](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.7.3/Gutter) or [TextEditor](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.7.3/TextEditor) would have the ability to create,what I'd like to call right now "phantom lines". Meaning, lines that exist in the editor and are editable from code, but are numberless and **do not affect the file** in any way, meaning they are just there visually. Something that would look like this.

![atom-numberless-lines](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14096473/15456154/9bff47cc-2070-11e6-8cbd-7e9131582cac.png)

This would be higly benefitial for creating packages that, for example, gather and display code statistics, linter information, or anything else, that's useful to have right on sight.

This, for example exists in VS, where CodeLens uses it to count references and `git` information

Currentlly, there does not seem to be a workaround for creating something like this with either markers or anything else. EDIT: [BlockDecorations](http://blog.atom.io/2016/02/03/introducing-block-decorations.html) may work though, have to investigate.

Possible feature set should allow to add phantom lines to either side of line `x`, the editing of content in it from code, but not from the editor, and possibly displaying icons in said lines.

data.title: [Theme] My custom theme .less files can't compile inside Atom but compile well outside
data.body:
Hi,
This is the first time I try to create an atom syntax theme.  

I have :  
1. Used the Generate Atom Syntax Theme
2. Wrote custom css / less in the files
3. At a random moment the project wouldn't compile anymore, with an error saying somewhat that the theme wasn't real as it hasn't a real repository yet
4. I copied the /styles directory and index.less outside atom folders, and it perfectly compiled to a correct css file
5. I tried validating the LESS code on the official less test tool : http://lesscss.org/less-preview/ and was fully successful
6. I even could compile the LESS files with any LESS compiler Atom package (tried a few)
7. I created a repository and officially pushed the syntax theme to Atom
8. I removed every package or theme previously installed
9. Installed the popsicles-syntax theme
10. Cried in the inside because it wasn't working and I was getting the exact same error...
    ### Steps
11. Install package
12. Try to use it

**Atom Version**: 1.7.3
**System**: Windows 7
**Thrown From**: [popsicles-syntax](https://github.com/melinadonati/popsicles-syntax) package, v0.3.0
### Stack Trace

Failed to activate the popsicles-syntax theme

```
At Unrecognised input in C:\Users\Melina\.atom\packages\popsicles-syntax\styles\base.less:484:2

LessError: Unrecognised input
  at C:\Users\Melina\.atom\packages\popsicles-syntax\styles\base.less:484:2
```
### Important

If the .less files are copied in a random directory and run through a less compiler, they output perfectly valid .css files.
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "themes": [
      "atom-dark-ui",
      "popsicles-syntax"
    ]
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
No installed packages

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Error working with Gnome - Google Drive files
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Install Ubuntu 16.04 with Gnome Desktop support (it also works with the [Unity version](http://www.webupd8.org/2016/03/use-gnome-318-google-drive-integration.html)).
2. Add Google account through gnome control center or `gnome-control-center online-accounts`. Then select to sync files.
3. Go to nautilus and select in the left panel your account
4. Select a file and try to open it (most of the times atom cannot open it and the process is blocked forever)
5. If atom opens, try to save the file.

**Atom Version**: 1.7.3
**System**: Ubuntu 16.04

data.title: Add a note how to hide the wrap-guide
data.body:
Ideally this would be an option in the settings, but maybe a note will already help too.

![screen shot 2016-05-21 at 10 27 45 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/15445687/e7b6288a-1f3e-11e6-9657-9555752c92de.png)

Refs: https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/790 + https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11782. There are many more issues and discussions about this, but these are just the recent two.

data.title: Following replaceSelectedText(), update the selected text range accordingly.
data.body: Following a call to `replaceSelectedText()`, the previous selected text range is not necessarily still relevant as that text has been replaced. The newly inserted text can possibly have a totally different range. Use the range of the newly inserted text as the final selection range.

data.title: Atom crash on opening publicly available repo
data.body:
### Description

Atom crashes on opening of certain folders.

It sounds similar to:  https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6674  but that issue was not resolved.

Performing git add -A does not resolve the issue, nor does reinstall, nor deleting all associated config files/folders.

If opening with `atom -f -d --safe .`  and it crashes I get the following error:

`[8992:0520/150300:WARNING:browser_accessibility_manager_win.cc(178)] Not firing AX event because of no root_delegate or hwnd`

in addition to the normal, non-crashing errors:

```
[8956:0520/151300:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[8956:0520/151300:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[8956:0520/151300:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[8956:0520/151300:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[8956:0520/151301:INFO:CONSOLE(52)] "Window load time: 527ms", source: file:///C:/Users/534139/AppData/Local/atom/app-1.7.3/resources/app.asar/static/index.js (52)
[8956:0520/151301:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] "/deep/ combinator is deprecated. See https://www.chromestatus.com/features/6750456638341120 for more details.", source: (0)
```
### Steps to Reproduce
1. `git clone http://git.infradead.org/users/willy/linux-nvme.git`
2. `cd linux-nvme`
3. `atom .`
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.3
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

Windows 10

I should note, the repo was cloned using cygwin, but the crash happens when launching atom from both cygwin and powershell.

data.title: utf encoding

data.title: application:new-file does not work
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?

- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I tries in different modes to hit CTRL + N or from the menu and it does not work.

It does not work for a few days.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom
2. Hit CTRL + N

Or...
1. Open Atom
2. Hit ALT (to show the top menu)
3. Click File
4. Click `New File`

**Expected behavior:**  to create an empty tab/file

**Actual behavior:** nothing :))
### Versions

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12199042/15435617/092aff8c-1ec6-11e6-99ef-43badd530c3a.png)

data.title: Configure verticalScrollMargin through Settings
data.body:
**tldr**: [verticalScrollMargin](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/73525a1bcc309ff64c6f930401cedc052ddcf408/src/text-editor.coffee#L71) should be configurable through Settings (`config.cson`).

I had a hard time searching for vim-like [scrolloff](http://vim.wikia.com/wiki/Make_search_results_appear_in_the_middle_of_the_screen#Scrolloff_option) feature in Atom.

Finally, I figured out that for this you have to write something like this in your **init.coffee**:

```
atom.workspace.observeTextEditors (editor) =>
    editor.setVerticalScrollMargin 8
```

There is even a [package](https://atom.io/packages/atom-scrolloff) where they tried to implement this feature because users experience difficulties trying to configure this.

data.title: Can't install Script Pckage on Atom

I had installed latest version of atom text editor but can't install Script Package in it.

1. sudo apm install script

**Actual behavior:**


Electron: 0.36.8

Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Atom autosave opened blank files when a location is mounted
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? I tried even in the beta
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? I know exactly what's happening
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? I assume that is not suitable
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? Maybe
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? I tried

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

A file present in a position not mounted get autosaved by a blank file and there is not a possibility to revert.
This bug happens to me since a script automatically mount in a folder my working dir thanks to my `~/.bashrc`. But sometimes it fails, and since I don't realise but I open atom as soon as the system finish boot, once I open up a terminal, bash automatically runs the script and try again to mount my working dir and all my files opened in Atom workspace get automatically saved and replaced with blank files.
**Please help me provide a better title and ask for more information if there is some need for a better understanding.**
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Enable autosave
2. Mount a drive
3. Open a file in the mounted folder
4. Enable the option for atom to save the workspace
5. Close atom
6. Unmount the drive
7. Open atom (Atom opens the file as blank, not finding it)
8. Mount the location

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
The file gets reloaded as soon as the mounting point is available or you get prompted regarding that.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
The file get replaced by atom automatically without options to reverting back (ctrl+z as example).
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.3
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
and
Atom    : 1.8.0-beta3
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Wrong line and cursor position with block decoration
data.body:
While playing with block decorations I noticed that on master the cursor is wrongly positionned when on a line with a block decoration:

![block-decoration](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/15425757/c8f10adc-1e8a-11e6-8b1b-f2b6316932f1.gif)

To reproduce you can use that snippet in your `init.coffee` file, it creates five block decorations randomly at the top of a file through the `editor:test-block-decorations` command:  

``` coffee
blockDecorations = []

clearBlockDecorations = ->
  blockDecorations.forEach (d) -> d.destroy()
  blockDecorations.length = 0

atom.commands.add 'atom-workspace',
  'editor:clear-block-decorations': clearBlockDecorations
  'editor:test-block-decorations': ->
    e = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()
    b = 0

    for i in [0..4]
      b += Math.round(Math.random() * 300)
      start = b
      b += Math.round(Math.random() * 300)
      end = b

      startPos = e.buffer.positionForCharacterIndex(start)
      endPos = e.buffer.positionForCharacterIndex(end)

      marker = e.markBufferRange([startPos, endPos], persistent: false,   invalidate: 'touch')

      props =
        type: 'block'
        item: document.createElement('div')

      props.item.textContent = "Decoration #{i}"
      props.item.style.cssText = 'background: red; width: 100%; height: 50px;'

      blockDecorations.push e.decorateMarker(marker, props)
```

``` shell
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.9.0-dev-8f1a691
Electron: 0.36.12
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

data.title: Add note about Xcode on El Captain
data.body: I have just built atom on my mac for the first time. I took me about 2 hours to do it successfully, because installing XCode with App Store **then** opening it was not so obvious. This PR adds a note about it before the little code snippet.

data.title: Unable to modify files owned by root in mac like it used to be able to
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When I want to modify any file owned by root, in my case an Apache conf file, atom says permission denied instead show a popup for credentials like it used to to before.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file owned by root
2. Try to modify
3. Try to save

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
A popup asking for credential
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
An alert saying permission denied
### Versions

Mac os 10.11.4-5
Atom mac 1.7.3
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.6.4
You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.
